President Donald Trump on Saturday railed against protesters, China and the media in an address marking America's Independence Day — typically a non-partisan celebration of national unity

name: politico
text:
Many people thought the coronavirus would plunge the Kentucky primary into chaos. But now, voting rights experts say other states should look to the Bluegrass State as an example of how to run a primary in a pandemic

name: politico
text:
In the last year, both the left and the right have been eager to claim the Lincoln Memorial and its symbolic backdrop. 

That's not a new American tradition — the memorial has a long history of allowing Americans to approach from all directions.
